Hello Scott,

Thank you for contacting Netwrix Technical Support. My name is Emiliano and I’ll be the engineer assisting you with this ticket.

You can download the version 3.3.0.8 from the portal, where the code signing certificate is not expired.

Please let me know if you have any question.

Thank you!
Regards,

ref:_00D7091pB._500Q000NMej8:ref

Thank you. That version does have a current/valid certificate.
But, for your information, if you run pingcastleautoupdater.exe from that v3.3.0.8 it downgrades both executables to 3.3.0.1.

Hi Scott,

Thanks for the update. 

That is expected right now. This is because autoupdater master is from GitHub and that is going to be updated soon.

Please let me know if you have any question or if there is anything else I can help you with.

Thank you!

We haven’t heard from you in a while, and I just wanted to see if you still need assistance with this issue. If you’re still experiencing problems or have any updates to share, please let me know. If the issue has been resolved, I can go ahead and close the ticket on my end. Please feel free to reply to this email with any updates or questions. We’re here to help you get the most out of your Netwrix products. Ticket Number: 00440092 Ticket Subject: Expired Code Signing Certificate on executables Ticket Details: The code signing certificate on pingcastle.exe 3.3.0.1 and pingcastleautoupdater.exe expired on 10/22/2024 and one of our clients is refusing to allow us to execute the tool on their systems because of it. Thank you! Emiliano Krainuk Technical Support Engineer ____________________ _________ Cybersecurity That Works for You 6160 Warren Parkway, Suite 100, Frisco, TX 75034 www.netwrix.com ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0NMej8:ref
